abstract: Banks are sitting out the busiest September for corporate bond sales in a sign they may refrain from lending while the Federal Reserve considers how to jolt the economic recovery.
snippet: Banks are sitting out the busiest September for corporate bond sales in a sign they may refrain from lending while the Federal Reserve considers how to jolt the economic recovery.
lead_paragraph: Banks are sitting out the busiest September for corporate bond sales in a sign they may refrain from lending while the Federal Reserve considers how to jolt the economic recovery, Bloomberg News reports.

headline.main: Banks Sitting Out Bond Surge as Lending Dries Up

abstract: Former President Bill Clinton bemoaned the lack of hedge-fund managers attending his 4- day conference, aimed at linking philanthropists with groups working to spur economic development around the world.
snippet: Former President Bill Clinton bemoaned the lack of hedge-fund managers attending his 4- day conference, aimed at linking philanthropists with groups working to spur economic development around the world.
lead_paragraph: Former President Bill Clinton said he has noticed that few hedge-fund managers attended his four-day conference aimed at linking philanthropists with groups working to spur economic development around the world.

headline.main: Clinton: Where Have All the Hedge Funds Gone?
